name: Dennis L. NESS and John E. Bowders, Appellants v. YORK TOWNSHIP BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS, Appellee
name_abbreviation: Ness v. York Township Board of Commissioners

judges: CASTILLE, C.J., SAYLOR, EAKIN, BAER, TODD, MCCAFFERY, STEVENS, JJ.
parties: Dennis L. NESS and John E. Bowders, Appellants v. YORK TOWNSHIP BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 15th day of December, 2014, the appeal is dismissed as having been IMPROVIDENTLY GRANTED.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Steven Mark Hovis, Esq., Christopher Lee Ryder, Esq., Stock and Leader, LLP, York, for York Township Board of Commissioners.
casebody.head_matter:
105 A.3d 1257
Dennis L. NESS and John E. Bowders, Appellants v. YORK TOWNSHIP BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Oct. 8, 2014.
Decided Dec. 15, 2014.
John E. Bowders, pro se.
Dennis L. Ness, pro se.
Steven Mark Hovis, Esq., Christopher Lee Ryder, Esq., Stock and Leader, LLP, York, for York Township Board of Commissioners.
CASTILLE, C.J., SAYLOR, EAKIN, BAER, TODD, MCCAFFERY, STEVENS, JJ.
